text:
If the 'HeaderName' file is 256 bytes or more, and it has mime type text/html,
Apache 2.2.4 returns an empty page. Problem occure on Solaris 9, see URL (1) for
an example. Problem disappears if the same requeest is done using https, URL
(2). Problem also doesn't happen in RHEL 4, URL (3). Also, problem is new to the
2.2.x series. 2.0.59 is OK.

(1) http://www.math.technion.ac.il/test_mod_auto_index/
(2) https://www.math.technion.ac.il/test_mod_auto_index/
(3) http://gilead.org.il/test_mod_auto_index/
creator: rl@math.technion.ac.il

text:
As shown in dev@apache.org mailing list, the problem is also client dependent, or as I see it, protocol dependent. For example, if I use HTTP/1.0, the problem disappears, and for HTTP/1.1, it reappears: HTTP 1.1 ======== ~$ curl -v http://www.math.technion.ac.il/test_mod_auto_index/256/ * About to connect() to www.math.technion.ac.il port 80 (#0) * Trying 132.68.115.2... connected * Connected to www.math.technion.ac.il (132.68.115.2) port 80 (#0) > GET /test_mod_auto_index/256/ HTTP/1.1 > User-Agent: curl/7.16.0 (i686-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.16.0 OpenSSL/0.9.8d zlib/1.2.3 libidn/0.5.6 > Host: www.math.technion.ac.il > Accept: */* > < HTTP/1.1 200 OK < Date: Thu, 18 Jan 2007 12:17:23 GMT < Server: Apache/2.2.4 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.2.4 OpenSSL/0.9.8d PHP/4.4.4 < Transfer-Encoding: chunked < Content-Type: text/html * Connection #0 to host www.math.technion.ac.il left intact * Closing connection #0 ============================================================================== HTTP/1.0 ======== ~$ curl -v -0 http://www.math.technion.ac.il/test_mod_auto_index/256/ * About to connect() to www.math.technion.ac.il port 80 (#0) * Trying 132.68.115.2... connected * Connected to www.math.technion.ac.il (132.68.115.2) port 80 (#0) > GET /test_mod_auto_index/256/ HTTP/1.0 > User-Agent: curl/7.16.0 (i686-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.16.0 OpenSSL/0.9.8d zlib/1.2.3 libidn/0.5.6 > Host: www.math.technion.ac.il > Accept: */* > < HTTP/1.1 200 OK < Date: Thu, 18 Jan 2007 12:17:33 GMT < Server: Apache/2.2.4 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.2.4 OpenSSL/0.9.8d PHP/4.4.4 < Connection: close < Content-Type: text/html XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
